p: Agmatine, (an arginine metabolite, structurally similar to GMQ) and arcaine (an analogue of agmatine) have also been shown to activate ASIC3 at pH 7.4 through interaction with the non-proton sensing domain, also referred to as the palm domain region of the receptor [ 195]. However, both arcaine ( Figure 7d) and agmatine ( Figure 7e) had the greatest effect (on both transient and sustain phase currents) at pH 5.0, increasing currents by 20% (EC 50 = 1.2 mM) and 7% (EC 50 = 9.7 mM), respectively. Given that inflammation increases both ASIC3 and agmatine expression [ 196], these in vitro results demonstrate that interaction between agmatine and ASIC3 could have in vivo significance in relation to pain.
